flawed_nl_solution:
The cost of the 200 employees is 200 employees * $12/employee/hour = $<<200*12=2400>>2400 per hour.
The cost of the 40 employees is 40 employees * $14/employee/hour = $<<40*14=560>>560 per hour.
The rest means 300 employees - 200 employees - 40 employees = <<300-200-40=80>>80 employees.
These 80 employees' employment costs are at 80 employees * $17/employee/hour = $<<80*17=1360>>1360 per hour.
So in total all employees earn $2400/hour + $560/hour + $1360/hour = $4320/hour.
During an 8-hour shift, this cost would be at 8 hours * $4320/hour = $<<8*4320=34560>>34560.
#### 34560

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 60, not 80. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
